STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 25, 2024
Natasha Doan - Motsinger
Our House- Mosaic
111 S. Wallace Blvd.,
Ypsilanti, MI, 48197-4644
RE: License#: CB810406448
Dear Ms. Doan-Motsinger:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 1/17/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy
(2) An agency shall maintain a file documentation from
the medical or dental provider of all medical and dental
care received by a foster child.
Three of three IL files did not have medical/dental documentation to accompany
the listed medical/dental exam in the case record.
CPA Rule 400.12505 Supervision
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum
supervision: (b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the
youth is complying with the terms of the agreement
required by R 400.12510, continues to reside in a safe
and acceptable environment, and is managing
expenditures.
Three of three IL files did not have monthly budgets for youth as required.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(4) An agency shall maintain an orientation and training
record for staff members
Eight of nine employee files did not have documentation of Orientation.

CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record must contain all the following
information before employment may occur:
(h) Documentation from the department that the person
has not been named in a central registry case as the
perpetrator of child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in
any state where the person lived in the 5 years
preceding hire.
Two of nine employee files did not have clearances as required. One new
employee resided in another state within the past year and a check was not
completed in that state. The second employee is in a position that does not have
contact with children; the agency did not believe a CPS check was required. TA
was provided.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record must contain all the following
information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
Six of nine employee files did not have three completed references as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/14/23 INTERIM, CAP approved 4/18/23.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following:
(b) A copy of the job description for the staff member’s
current position.
Seven of nine employee files did not have job descriptions.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/14/23 INTERIM, CAP approved 4/18/23
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(3) The personnel record must contain both of the
following: (a) A written evaluation of a staff member’s
performance within a probationary period or not later
than 6 months after the staff member assumes his or
her current responsibilities.

Two of nine employee files did not have probationary performance reviews
completed as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/14/23 INTERIM, CAP approved 4/18/23.
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record must contain all the following
information before employment may occur:
(b) Verification of education.
One of nine employee files did not have verification of education.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Employee References- Prior to hire, three unrelated references must be
completed. Completed means the reference was contacted and provided
information about the applicant. If a reference does not respond to agency
requests, alternate references may be used.
• CPS Clearances- A CPS clearance must be completed prior to hire, for all
agency employees, regardless of position. In addition, an out of state CPS
clearance must be completed in any state the applicant has resided in within
the five years prior to hire.
• Mandated reporting- Mandated reporting information was reviewed with the
CA as it was part of a recent special evaluation and CAP.
• Special Investigations- The agency was reminded of the importance of
responding timely to all DCWL Consultants. Failure to respond and provide
information in a timely manner, may result in a rule violation.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
A CAP was approved on 4/18/23 as a result of the 3/14/23 Interim review. The
CAP addressed six violations regarding employee files, IL Contracts, and IL
termination documentation. During the current review eight violations were found,
including three repeat violations regarding employee files. While the agency has
shown improvement in some areas, a new CAP is required to address the current
violations.
A CAP was approved on 10/5/23 as a result of Special Investigation
CB810406448. The agency was cited regarding Rule 214, Compliance with child
protection law. CAP follow-up was completed in January 2024 and found the
agency has been following the CAP action steps. CAP follow-up will continue until
April 2024.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed. The CA
reported the agency has struggled this year due to several external factors that
impacted the CA and the Supervisor. As this is a small program, the CA and
Supervisor are the primary resources for the program. When they are out of the
office, there is no one available to cover the workload. The CA stated they have
done their best to keep up this year, but it has been difficult.
In addition, the IL house has also struggled with an increase in crime in the area.
The CA cited a 300% crime increase in the community, which has increased the
need for law enforcement interactions with some of the IL youth.
Also, the agency has been working hard to provide additional services and
interventions to youth with increasing mental health needs. The CA indicated that
securing funding for additional services has been challenging.
Despite these challenges, the agency has adjusted and adapted. They have
begun using a new staffing model that seems to work well and provide an extra
layer of support for staff and youth. The CA is involved in community projects and
work groups at the state level to help strengthen IL services.
Overall, while the work is difficult, the CA is optimistic about the future.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were found.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One staff was interviewed. Staff reported the agency had a challenging year, but
things have started to settle down. The program is running smoothly and youth are
benefiting from services. There were no concerns identified or suggestions for
improvement.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be housed in a former school building, with other
community businesses. Their space has adequate storage for confidential
information. Staff have sufficient space to complete job duties, as well as meeting
space for client contacts.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This agency is Independent Living only.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
January 23, 2024
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
1/24/2024
